message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about neural machine translation, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the computer science category of "Computation and Language" (cs.CL). The paper proposes a method for optimizing the segmentation granularity of subword units used in NMT, which involves tuning a hyperparameter. This could be seen as a machine learning problem, which falls under the categories of "Machine Learning" (cs.LG) and "Artificial Intelligence" (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the benefits of the proposed method for rare words, which could be relevant to the category of "Neural and Evolutionary Computing" (cs.NE). Finally, the paper mentions the use of embeddings, which are commonly used in computer vision (CV) and could be relevant to the category of "Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition" (cs.CV).
